title: 103_hr1313
content: The Act titled "National Cooperative Production Amendments of 1993" is cited for short. It includes findings and purposes. The National Cooperative Production Amendments of 1993 aims to promote innovation, facilitate trade, and strengthen the competitiveness of the United States by clarifying the applicability of the rule of reason standard and establishing a procedure for businesses to engage in cooperative innovation arrangements. The National Cooperative Production Amendments of 1993 clarifies the rule of reason standard and allows businesses to notify authorities of their cooperative ventures to qualify for a single-damages limitation on civil antitrust liability. SEC. 3. AMENDMENTS. The National Cooperative Research Act of 1984 is amended to the National Cooperative Research and Production Act of 1993. Definitions are updated to include production activities in addition to research and development. The National Cooperative Research Act of 1984 is amended to the National Cooperative Research and Production Act of 1993, updating definitions to include production activities. Amendments include exclusions related to conducting research and development, agreements restricting marketing, distribution, or provision of products, processes, or services. The National Cooperative Research Act of 1984 was amended to the National Cooperative Research and Production Act of 1993, which included updates to definitions to encompass production activities. The amendments outlined exclusions related to the distribution, marketing, and licensing of products, processes, or services developed through cooperative ventures. The National Cooperative Research Act of 1984 was amended to the National Cooperative Research and Production Act of 1993, which included updates to definitions to encompass production activities. The amendments outlined exclusions related to the distribution, marketing, and licensing of products, processes, or services developed through cooperative ventures. Amendments were made to subparagraphs (A) and (B) to clarify parties involved in ventures. Additional prohibitions were added regarding market allocation, information exchange among competitors, and conduct restrictions. The National Cooperative Research Act of 1984 was amended to the National Cooperative Research and Production Act of 1993, which included updates to definitions to encompass production activities. The amendments outlined exclusions related to the distribution, marketing, and licensing of products, processes, or services developed through cooperative ventures. Prohibitions were added regarding market allocation, information exchange among competitors, and conduct restrictions in production activities. The National Cooperative Research Act of 1984 was amended to the National Cooperative Research and Production Act of 1993, which included updates to definitions to encompass production activities. The amendments outlined exclusions related to the distribution, marketing, and licensing of products, processes, or services developed through cooperative ventures. Prohibitions were added regarding market allocation, information exchange among competitors, and conduct restrictions in production activities. The amendments also included technical and conforming amendments to the Act. The National Cooperative Research Act of 1984 was amended to the National Cooperative Research and Production Act of 1993, which included updates to definitions to encompass production activities. The amendments outlined exclusions related to the distribution, marketing, and licensing of products, processes, or services developed through cooperative ventures. Prohibitions were added regarding market allocation, information exchange among competitors, and conduct restrictions in production activities. The amendments also included technical and conforming amendments to the Act, such as changing dates and headings in sections related to disclosure requirements. The National Cooperative Research Act of 1984 was amended to the National Cooperative Research and Production Act of 1993, which included updates to definitions to encompass production activities. Amendments were made to limit the identity and nationality disclosure requirements for parties involved in cooperative ventures. Additionally, restrictions on the use of "research and development" terminology were implemented. The National Cooperative Research Act of 1984 was amended to the National Cooperative Research and Production Act of 1993, which included updates to definitions to encompass production activities. Amendments were made to limit identity and nationality disclosure requirements for parties involved in cooperative ventures, as well as restrictions on the use of "research and development" terminology. Application of Section 4 Protections to Production of Products, Processes, and Services. Sec. 7 states that the protections of section 4 do not apply to joint ventures' production unless the principal facilities are in the US or its territories, and each controlling person is a US or foreign person from a country with favorable antitrust treatment. The National Cooperative Research and Production Act of 1993 requires the Attorney General to submit an annual report to Congress detailing joint ventures filed under the Act, including their purpose and the parties involved. The Attorney General must submit a triennial report to Congress detailing joint ventures filed under the National Cooperative Research and Production Act of 1993, including parties involved and cases brought under antitrust laws. The Attorney General must submit a triennial report to Congress on joint ventures filed under the National Cooperative Research and Production Act of 1993, analyzing trends in competitiveness and antitrust treatment of US businesses in such ventures under foreign laws. The Attorney General must report to Congress on joint ventures under the National Cooperative Research and Production Act of 1993, analyzing competitiveness and antitrust treatment of US businesses in such ventures under foreign laws.
